definition[0]: when something is divided and shared out, or an amount of something that has been divided and shared out
example[0]: the apportionment of financial support to those states worst affected by the crisis
definition[1]: when each expense is placed in its proper account, or the amount placed in each account
definition[2]: when insurance companies or their clients agree to share the cost of something that goes wrong, or the amount that each person or company agrees to pay
example[2]: The excess shall be deducted prior to apportionment between the two insurers.
definition[3]: when the buyer and seller of a property agree to share the cost of a bill, for example property tax, that is paid to cover a period during which they will each be owners for a time
example[3]: You should stipulate the apportionment of any service charge liability in the sale agreement.
